actions.committee: House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service
actions.text: Referred to House Committee on Post Office and Civil Service.

committees.committee: House Post Office and Civil Service

official_title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to limit the circumstances in which the Postal Service may close post offices serving rural areas and small communities and towns.

summary.text: Prohibits the closing of a post office serving a rural area or small town solely on the basis that such post office is operating at a deficit unless: (1) the Postal Service determines that equivalent or improved services will be provided either by a city, rural, or star route carrier or by another postal facility; and (2) a survey of persons using the post office which the Postal Service proposes to close indicates that a majority of the persons responding do not oppose such closing.

titles.title: A bill to amend title 38, United States Code, to limit the circumstances in which the Postal Service may close post offices serving rural areas and small communities and towns.
